page.title: 05SHOOTING SEASON
page.content: The{grouse shooting season}starts on August 12th.The gamekeeper has one {labrador}and 3{spaniels}to help him. During the season the gamekeeper's job is to organise the allocation of {shooting butts}to the shooter. The shooters come from all over the world. Each butt is numbered. The shooters take a stick with a number on it and shoot from the butt with that number. The gamekeeper then has to tell the {beaters}where to stand and when to start to beat. About 20 or 30 beaters are employed. They stand in a long line and wave flags.This makes the grouse fly up so they can be shot. After the shoot the grouse are taken back to the keeper's house and put into the game larder.The beater receives Â£10 for each days shooting.The game dealer collects the grouse and it is taken to be sold.
